meanings.definition: Capable of catching fire and burning.
meanings.sent1: The dry leaves were highly combustible and caught fire easily.
meanings.sent2: It is important to store flammable materials away from combustible items.
meanings.sent3: The campfire was so hot that even the most combustible twigs ignited instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her temper was like a combustible substance, ready to explode at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The old barn was a tinderbox, filled with combustible hay and straw.

meanings.definition: A substance that is able to catch fire and burn easily.
meanings.sent1: The firefighters were cautious when entering the building filled with combustible chemicals.
meanings.sent2: Gasoline is a common combustible used in engines.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to be a bottomless pit of combustible materials.
meanings.sent4: The rumors spreading through the town were like a combustible fuel, igniting gossip everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The warehouse stored various combustibles, from paint cans to propane tanks.
